page.title: 06Todmorden Carnival
page.content: Todmorden Carnival is held on the third Saturday of May every year. Children and adults ride on decorated wagons, called floats, and parade the streets in fancy dress.Some people wear uniforms and play instruments and twirl things called batons.Other people line the streets to watch the procession.Then they all go to Centre Vale Park where there are charity stalls, a funfair and a five-a-side football competition for primary schoolboys.On the fair there were dodgem cars, a waltzer and games where you could win a goldfish.If you were brave, you could go on the cable slide, where you climbed a structure and then slide down a rope. This year it was pouring with rain, but people still came in their thousands.
